ratings.comment: I know she's retired, but I have to say... in 4 years at UW, I have never encountered such an unpleasant, unhelpful person.  She was downright rude to me, on several occasions.  She made me hate womens studies.  She really disgusts me.

Kind woman, clearly has a passion for her work, but prattles too much about social organizing and the history of the class. material is great, textbook (compiled by her) is phenomenal, she pretty much tells you what is going to be on the very easy tests. expect to hear the same things over and over in lecture. too bad she's retiring this semester!
EXTREMELY easy - just go to lecture, memorize the handouts, and skim over the readings to get a basic idea of them. VERY feminist view of things, but still interesting. Nancy is also extremely kind.

I felt like the class was more like a history of the class and a history of what we will talk about. I also consider myself a very passionate feminist but still found the class very one-sided and did not agree with a lot of it.
Prepares you extremely well for the tests!

This class was wonderful, content-wise. However, Nancy was one of the most frustrating professors I've ever had. Spent half the class on useless information we could have gotten from a syllabus. Corny, repetitive, and teaches as if everyone in the class is a freshman (which is good for the freshman, but not so good for everyone else.)
Take this class! It's really straightforward, fairly interesting, and easy to understand. Nancy goes through the exam layout before each one and if you study for an hour or two you'll be fine.
Great teacher, you'll get an A as long as you read and pay attention.  Easy extra credit points too.  TAs can be a little confusing but listen in lecture and you'll be fine
By far the best class I have ever taken. Learn more valuable information than you will from any other class. She tells you exactly what will be on the exam.
Easy A.  Nancy can be too much at times, but most of the material is interesting.  All you have to do is skim the articles and look at lecture notes before a test and you're golden.

great class. It's pretty easy and the prof is one sided,  but there's still a lot of good information. the readings are long and get boring, but they still show up on the test. this classes is all about women's bodies and it's good for anyone to take.

Nancy is extremely one sided and biased about pretty much everything she says.  I took this class only for the science and disagreed with her about pretty much everything else she said.  The tests are easy because in lecture she tells you everything that is going to be on them and you just have to skim the articles a few days before the test.

Some lectures were amazing and really thought provoking, yet others were very boring. It is not necessary to do all of the reading, get the main points and you will be fine. That's what I did and I easily got an A. Make sure you know the science well, because that can get you on tests. Also, the papers really make a difference, START EARLY!

Nancy is a great lecturer! I learned SO MUCH in this class! There are a TON of (boring) readings, and 3 REEEEALLY long (but relatively easy) tests. My TA, Hannah, was the BEST TA I've ever had and she played a huge part in why I liked the class so much! 2 really short, easy papers and LOTS of extra credit opportunities! Class is highly recommended!

Nancy is an awesome professor!  You learn a lot in the class and you really should do the readings but they're very interesting so it's not too bad.  The TA's grade the papers a little hard compared to the exams which are verrrryyyy easy.  Very good science course for nonscience people.  Easy A.
Overall easy course - Nancy makes things fun and simple to learn - you know exactly what's on the exam.

I also really enjoyed this class. Nancy really knows what she is talking about and makes the class interested in the material. As far as papers/exams, there isn't too much work; two exams, two papers and a final. Overall, I would say this class is an easier science credit for non-science oriented students.

I really enjoyed Nancy's class.  I learned things about my body I was ashamed I didn't already know.  This class should be required.  I only had one occassion to go to Nancy's office to talk to her and she was extremely nice to me and really made me feel comfortable.

Everyone should take this class. Yes, she is biased, but she has good reason to be. I think the people who gave her bad ratings are just upset because she disrupted their small-minded worldviews. If you are willing to open your eyes to the injustices in this world, take this class...it is phenomenal.

very judgemental against people who are not like her.  hard to get in touch with.  really outrageously rude when i went to see her outside of class.  her attitude and treatment/lack of respect for students and her TAs really turned me off to the subject.

very judgemental against people who are not like her.  hard to get in touch with.  really outrageously rude when i went to see her outside of class.  her attitude and treatment/lack of respect for students and her TAs really turned me off to the subject.

Enjoyed the class; my only complaint is that when I took the class, she did not have an e-mail address and she was extremely difficult to communicate with in person.  I consistenly had to go through my TA to contact her.  Even then, Nancy never contacted me, rather, she would send messaged through the TA.

The class was great. I loved the material. I think all women should take this class. Nancy is a little obnoxious, but her tests were very easy and fair. Obviously, this is a women's studies class; you're gonna get some liberal perspectives, so don't take this class if you aren't open to new ideas.

Easy class, but lectures are are useless. She spends too much time talking about what she's going to talk about and never seems to get to the point. She does give out handouts in lectures, which are helpful.

You do learn a lot of interesting things in this class, but Nancy herself is kind of abrasive. She was never rude to me, but when I was in the WS office once another girl came in with questions and Nancy was just awful to her, not helpful and plain mean. It would be nice to take the class with a different prof.

this woman was terrible to deal with.  she was downright abusive.  i have never felt so disrepsected by another humanbeing.  i would say, take this class as a last resort.  it was not fun no was it interesting, and the professor ruined the subject matter for me.

I LOVED this class! I expected to not like it, but she is so open and accepting, all the while teaching the class important things that are ignored in earlier education. You cannot slack off, but the time spent is well worth it!

Nancy is Great. I don't really understand the comment below mine. I went to class and discussion, never did any of the readings and am getting an A. With three exams (the final is worth the same as the other two midterms) and two, two page papers. This class is easy, and AMAZING. by FAR my favorite class thus far at UW. LOVE LOVE LOVE it. TAKE IT!

Probably the most tedious and ridiculous class I've taken. If the lectures weren't so one-sided and politically based, I would have gotten a lot more out of it. Tests are incredibly long and subjective. Good health info, but horrible professor. If you are just taking this for an "easy" science credit, DROP while you still can.
Good lecturer, but she spends every class discussing what she WILL talk about, but rarely addressing it.

a biology class does NOT need to be so damn feminist drivin.  if you arent interested in feminist ****, i suggest you find another class.  otherwise, the prof, TAs, and other students in the class will drive you nuts.  books are extremely expensive and repetitive.  also, not enough time to finish the extremely long exams she gives.

This was the most interesting class I have taken.  It will definitely open your eyes.  The material is easy, and she tells you ahead of time what will be on the exam.  If you're looking for an interesting class for which you won't have to spend too much time on, this is it.

She is very involved in her work, and passionate as well. Nancy is very clear about exactly what is going to be on exams, and what information you need to know. Excellent information is provided--I recommend this class to all women, as well as men.

The class is really interesting in terms of the information, but she is frustrating to no end. You can tell she's very passionate and informed, but she goes on and on about stupid things. And if you don't want to hear about how "magical" your ovaries are day in and day out, skip class and do the reading instead. Worked for me.

By far THE best class I've taken. It was very informational in regards to women's health--something that isn't spoken on much in our society. The worksheets and exam reviews really helped and it was nice of her to cut the exam length after we all complained about how long it was. I really enjoyed this course and recomm. it to anyone.

I learned some interesting things in this class, but it made me feel very uncomfortable at times because it imposes such liberal views on you.  Lectures can be very boring and she usually just tells you what she's going to talk about, leaving very little time for the actual material.  VERY easy exams and an easy 3 credit science class with no lab!!
I can't believe this woman is allowed to teach.  What a joke she is.

easy class, but lecture is almost pointless. all of the info you need is on worksheets, which you can find online. Good information, but it you can tell she is biting her liberal tongue when it comes to certain topics. if you dont want to hear the words "fat and juicy" or have her not really teach you anything, avoid it.

This class sort of reminded me of a seventh grade health class- it is very straight forward and she does not try to trick you. The topic is relevant and interesting for women in general. She does have a strong feminist political stance, and that could be alienating. She wastes a lot of time talking about what are learning instead of just teaching.
Nancy is a pathetic professor.  She's a horrible teacher, and her political agenda is quite evident.  Never even considers other points of view.  Incompetent lecturer as well.
Fails to ever address new information. Too much time informing about what we will talk about, but never really talk about it. Likes her book too much
this class just sucks.  dont take it if you dont like feminism.  she should spend lecture teaching the material, not telling us how easy the test will be.

Nancy is extremely passionate about her work and that is clear.  BUT, I couldn't stand to listen to her talk for 50 minutes!  She dances around the subjects by saying "We will talk about..." and then never really gets anywhere.  Easy class, painful lectures.

This class was amazing.  I learned so much about myself and the way that the healthcare system is structured.  Definitely take this class.  The science part of it is actually really easy, you just have to memorize some basic stuff and you'll do fine.  Anyone who has taken an intro bio course should have no problem.
Prof Worcester was incredibly clear about what students need to know to do well in the class- and it's always basic, important information that's helpful in your real life.

This class was literally painful. Sitting throught lecture was like having teeth pulled. Some useful info, but really not worth an hour of your time three times a week. Never went to class and aced every exam, piece of cake. But if you don't like having other people's opinions pushed on you don't take this class.

I really enjoyed this class, it presents another view of things that you won't see unless you take a women's studies or race/ethnicity course. It realy addressed the problems with the societal structure of the healthcare system. The biology wasn't bad, just read it over. If you do the readings and attend lecture, it's an easy course. The TA's are w

The most annoying professor ever. She's so biased and everything is a bunch of liberal crap. She is so hard to listen and I ever hear her say "DON'T WRITE THIS DOWN!" or "fat and juicy" again, I might go absolutely insane. I learned a lot, but she only presents her view on things and regards any other as completely ludicrous. Lecture was pointless.
soo hard and long tests and a lot of studying about the most detailed of things...a lot of focus on biology and less on issues

So everyone told me that this would be an easy science credit, and granted it isn't that difficult: the tests are way too long, want you to recite back specifics, and her directions for everything are long-winded and contradictory...while lectures are useful b/c she tells you test ?'s, i can barely stand listening to her for 50 minutes

Nanc is amazing. This class has taught me so much about my own body, as well as women in general. I always looked forward to going to both lecture and discussion. Tests are long but easy if you study.
Lectures were useless, but go anyway. Tests are LONG, very hard if you do not study, quite easy if you put some time in. I look forward to discussions because it is very involved and interesting.

I learned so much in this class that is useful for life in general... things every woman should know.  Prof Worcester is very passionate about women's health and is a great resource.  I highly recommend going to see her during office hours if you have the time.
Doesn't really teach you anything.

Lectures are pointless and boring. The only thing interesting are the movie clips. Discussions were awesome(considering you get a good TA) Material is very interesting. Every women(and men) should this course.

Nancy's lectures sometimes DID dance around the actual subject, but I loved discussion.  The TA's really knew their stuff and made the class so enjoyable and interesting.  Even if Nancy struggled with lecture, she was very helpful outside of class and was willing to discuss anything with her students.  She's a great resource.

Nancy is the WORST lecturer I have had at Madison. The subject matter is interesting, but she somehow manages to make class a living hell. She always says "we're going to talk about ..." but never actually discusses anything. If you do the reading you'll be fine. The guest lecturers are awesome.

Listening to her lectures is exhausting. She spends so much of the time talking about how valuable the class is that there is no time left to discuss the subject matter. If you want to learn something this class is not for you.
This professor spends about the first 3 or 4 weeks of class lecturing on what is going to happen during the semester.  It's a joke.  Memorize the handouts and you'll be fine.

This is a class that everyone should take. Nancy is very passionate about this subject and is a very good teacher. Lots of reading, but she will always make it clear what you need to know. Definately take this class!

Great class that every woman should take.  I totally disagree with the above poster's "extremist politics" comment.  I have no idea where that came from.  Simple, straightforward exams and an altogether rewarding experience.

Nancy cares a lot about women's health and is very well read on the subject.  It may seem like hardcore feminism at times because you will be forced to confront a lot of difficult truths.  If you want to take a really worthwhile class then this is for you!  Every woman should take it (and men, too!)

this is just about the easiest class i've taken on this campus.  i consider myself a feminist and i still felt i was being indoctrinated by the lectures.  discussions were much better.  easy easy easy but annoying.
Awesome class... Every female should take it.  It's so interesting.  Prof. Worcester is very dynamic, interesting, and funny!  I highly recommend this course to everyone!
The class was fairly easy as a natural science requirement, however, I found her extremist politics and anti-religious comments highly alienating to anyone religious or remotely interested in men.

Nancy is a wonderful professor... all 5 of her TAs were excellent as well.  This is a great Natural Science requirement to take and it also helps you gain new perspectives on topics you may not have thought about in depth...
great professor, gives very fair tests. take this class! it's amazing.
No Comments
she's awesome and so is the class
She makes the class really interesting

This class is so easy.  There is a lot to read, but you only have to read what she tells you is going to be on the tests.  She is annoying though because she always talks about what she is going to talk about and themes and stuff.

The overall course material was very interesting, but the professor didn't really add anything extra.  The readings and the discussion sections are when you learn the most.  Be prepared for mega-feminism - it can be overwhelming at points.

Not only is she a phenomenal lecturer, but she is friendly, approachable and wonderful.  If you dont like her, its probably because you skipped lecture too many times and dont appreciate the tremendous value of the course.
SHE IS AWESOME

The overall course material was very interesting, but the professor often went off topic during lecture. She used her position as a soap box for her own political views. The discussion was good and the exams were very easy.
if you are not a feminist or a **** do not take this course, if you like men, do not take this course!
No Comments
No Comments
excellent TA, bad prof!!! Worcester does not like men and it showed! TA saved the class!
